featuredVideos.htmlCaption: Jean-Paul Engelen, Deputy Chairman and Worldwide Co-Head of 20th Century & Contemporary Art, takes us on a personal tour of our 20th Century & Contemporary Art Evening Sale viewing at 450 Park Avenue in New York. Featuring more than 20 lots, the Evening Sale includes works by artists highly sought after in today’s market including Joan Mitchell, Helen Frankenthaler, Gerhard Richter, Jean-Michel Basquiat, Matthew Wong and more.

Created during a short burst of intense output, this vibrant painting clearly shows this self-taught artist's obsession for materials. This work will be offered in our upcoming 20th Century & Contemporary Art Evening Sale in New York on 2 July 2020.
Phillips’ international auctions are the building blocks of a great collection—and we've made it easier than ever to bid from anywhere in the world.

featuredContent.htmlCaption:
Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Jill Weinberg Adams on Joan Mitchell

Robert Manley, Phillips Deputy Chairman and Worldwide Co-Head of 20th Century & Contemporary Art, speaks with Jill Weinberg Adams, who worked closely with Joan Mitchell at Xavier Fourcade Gallery.

Feature Article | Watches

Specialists Pick: Highlights From The Geneva Watch Auction XI

Ahead of the sale, we asked our Geneva-based Watches Specialists to talk us through some of their favorites.

Feature Article | Watches

Auction Preview: A Selection of Glamorous Rolex Day-Date Models

An ever-changing chameleon, the Day-Date is one of the most diverse Rolex models ever produced. Tiffany To presents a selection of exceptional and very colorful models consigned to our next Geneva sale.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Gerhard Richter: Truth in Abstraction

With a practice that has oscillated from photorealist to completely non-representational, the German painter has remained an artistic force to be reckoned with through constant innovation.

Feature Article | Watches

The Eternal Appeal of Cartier Wristwatches

Ahead of The Gevena Watch Auction: XI, renowned author and watch journalist Nick Foulkes pens a declaration of love for the timeless beauty of Cartier's shape-shifting wristwatches.

Feature Article | Watches

One Of Twenty: Owning F.P. Journe's First Wristwatches

Arthur Touchot meets Lorenz Bäumer, one of the consignors of The Geneva Watch Auction: XI, to learn about two fresh-to-market F.P Journe wristwatches made before the watchmaker's rise to stardom.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

First Reveal: Matthew Wong

Ahead of our Evening and Day Sales, taking place on 2 July, we're unveiling two fresh-to-market works by the late Canadian artist.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

ART MATTERS@home

ART MATTERS@home is an ongoing series of conversations with icons of the art world, led by Arnold Lehman, Phillips' Senior Advisor and Director Emeritus, The Brooklyn Museum. This week, Arnold sits down with filmmaker Timothy Greenfield-Sanders.

Feature Article | Photographs

Peter Fetterman on His Favorite Photographs

The longtime gallerist reflects on some of his most-loved works coming to auction, and his relationships with the photographers who took them.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Phillips x Design Trust Charity Auction

Phillips is delighted to offer a special curated selection with Design Trust, an initiative of the Hong Kong Ambassadors of Design, as part of the 20th Century & Contemporary Art & Design Hong Kong Day Sale.

Feature Article | Editions

Specialist Picks: Contemporary Editions

Learn more from our specialists about the exceptional prints and multiples coming to auction in our online-only sale.

Feature Article | Design

House Calls: Bethan Laura Wood

We caught up with the mixed media artist to discuss the importance of handling materials, which soundtracks she has on rotation while working and where her practice is heading.

Feature Article | Design

Jochen Eisenbrand's Design Favorites

The Chief Curator of the Vitra Design Museum in Weil am Rhein, Germany, shares a selection of works from our London Design auction, taking place on 19 June.

Feature Article | Jewels

Robert Procop: The Art of Giving Back

We've partnered with the Los Angeles jeweler to donate proceeds from the sale of his pieces, all offered with no reserve, to several charitable organizations.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

VR Walkthrough: 20th Century & Contemporary Art, Hong Kong

Join us for a virtual walkthrough from Taipei of our Hong Kong 20th Century & Contemporary Art Sales. On view: Zao Wou-Ki, Daniel Arsham, Eddie Martinez, Nicole Eisenman and more.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

First Reveal: Charles White

“Art must be an integral part of the struggle. It can’t simply mirror what’s taking place...It must ally itself with the forces of liberation.” – Charles White

Feature Article | Jewels

Specialist Picks: Jewels & More

See which pieces from our online auction of classic and contemporary jewels speak to our team of experienced specialists.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In Conversation with Carlos Alberto Chateaubriand

We spoke with the Brazilian collector from his farm in rural São Paulo, to hear about his work with the Museu de Arte Moderna and the new cultural center that will house a portion of his family collection.

Feature Article | Photographs

Tailor-Made

Our online auction of fashion photography, all from the collection of Santa Monica gallerist Peter Fetterman, captures the medium's creativity throughout the 20th century.

Feature Article | Design

VR Walkthrough: Design

Tour our Design sale in this virtual reality walkthrough from 30 Berkeley Square. On view: Gio Ponti, Fontana Arte, Max Ingrand, Claude Lalanne and more.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

First Reveal: Maxfield Parrish

In anticipation of our 20th Century & Contemporary Art Evening Sale, we’re unveiling a prescient work of American art coming to the open market for the first time.

Feature Article | Editions

Specialist Picks: Modern Editions

Learn from our team about the classic 20th-century prints coming to auction in our online-only sale.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

House Calls: Beatriz Milhazes

Regional Director, Brazil, Candida Sodre sat down with the Rio de Janeiro-based artist to discuss the artist's multidisciplinary practice and her upcoming exhibitions.

Feature Article | Design

Brilliant Repetition: Dunand's Eggshell Lacquer Designs

Retaining an organic quality while anticipating a more mechanized expression of the Art Deco style, Jean Dunand's set of three nesting tables seamlessly combine simplicity of form and geometric decoration.

Feature Article | Design

The Seduction of Stillness

An impressive feat of sustained making, ‘Kamen’ is also a cyclical act of reception—refining, improving and extending the same forms and materials.

Annoucement | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Auction Update: Gallery Reopenings & Upcoming Sales

As the world begins to emerge from lockdown, we’re pleased to share how the spring season is progressing.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

House Calls: Angel Otero

The New York-based artist lets us into his studio and tells us how sheltering-in-place has proven to be positive for his mind and practice.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

First Reveal: Vivian Springford & John Chamberlain

In advance of our 20th Century & Contemporary Art Day Sale this July, we're revealing two exciting works to be offered in our Morning and Afternoon sessions.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

What's Next for Craft Contemporary

Exhibitions Curator Holly Jerger shared how the Los Angeles institution has adapted to evolving circumstances, and which changes she thinks are here to stay.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

A Symbiotic Relationship

Collaborating with emerging contemporary artists across a breadth of mediums, pop-star Charli XCX's new album features one-of-a-kind artwork by Seth Bogart, Allison Zuckerman, Sarah Cynwar and more.

Feature Article | Design

Suspended Expression: Kuramata's 'Miss Blanche' Chair

An homage to Miss Blanche DuBois, the heroine in Tennessee Williams' 'A Streetcar Named Desire,' the present chair has become one of the most iconic designs in Shiro Kuramata's oeuvre.

Feature Article | Jewels

In Conversation with Paul Redmayne

We sat down with our new Head of Private Sales, Jewelry, to learn more about his journey to Phillips on the road less traveled and the department’s new online selling platform, Flawless.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

An Interview with Asia Art Archives' Claire Hsu

Phillips is proud to support the Hong Kong charity through the sale of an exceptional photograph by Wolfgang Tillmans.

Feature Article | Design

The Whimsical and the Tropical: A Unique Table

This exceptional piece by Claude Lalanne, designed for a client's home in the Caribbean, reveals the full scope of her irreplaceable imagination.

Feature Article | Jewels

Vivienne Becker Meets Albert Boghossian

The Phillips contributor meets one of Geneva's most important jewelers, whose family has been in the business for five generations.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Specialist Picks from REFRESH:RELOAD

See what works of contemporary art, jewels and watches from our first Hong Kong cross-category online auction speak to our specialists.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In Conversation with Alice Trier

We spoke with the Cologne-based Specialist to learn about her lifelong involvement in Germany's contemporary art scene and what advice she gives young collectors.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

The Unfaltering Gaze: Amoako Boafo

In his contemplative and charismatic portraits, Boafo celebrates individual identity through an unmistakable array of color and line.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

House Calls: Bianca Nemelc

We caught up with the New York City-based artist who spoke to us about her upcoming solo show this summer, the use of nature within her paintings and the importance of having a sense of self.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

What's Next for Oolite Arts

We spoke with Dennis Scholl, President and CEO of Miami-based Oolite Arts, and three Miami artists about how they are adapting to life and work during an uncertain time.

Feature Article | Jewels

Vivienne Becker Meets Alisa Moussaieff

In this week's episode, Vivienne Becker meets the matriarch of one of jewelry's most prominent families.

Feature Article | Design

House Calls: Anders Herwald Ruhwald

The Danish-born and Chicago-based ceramic artist tells us more about his upcoming show at the Indianapolis Museum of Art, the research that goes into glazes and how the physical object helps him to create.

Feature Article | Jewels

Karen Suen in Conversation with Terry Chu

Our Head of Jewelry, Asia, sat down with Karen Suen, an award-winning Hong Kong-based jeweler with an international following, to talk about her choice of gemstones and design aesthetic.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Director John W. Smith on What's Next for the RISD Museum

We spoke with the museum's director to hear about how the Rhode Island institution plans to further its mission at the nexus of the arts and education.

Feature Article | Jewels

Vivienne Becker Meets Shaun Leane

In the second installment of our interview series, Vivienne Becker chats with renowned jeweler and goldsmith Shaun Leane.

Feature Article | Photographs

Stephen Shore on 'American Surfaces'

The renowned American photographer spoke with Phillips’ Vanessa Hallett about his practice, influences and the new edition of his acclaimed book from Phaidon.

Feature Article | Design

House Calls: Alev Ebüzziya Siesbye

We caught up with the Paris-based ceramist who shared how vibration—and not perfection—are part of her minimal practice.

Feature Article | Jewels

An Interview with Wooa Kim

Associate Specialist Anne Mock, G.G., had the chance to speak with the jewelry designer and illustrator about her path into the field and what advice she'd give to others interested in pursuing the same.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Chief Curator Connie Butler on What's Next for the Hammer Museum

Reflecting our ongoing commitment to museums and the arts community at large, we've been checking in to see how they're planning ahead during uncertain times.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Wolfgang Tillmans: Imposing the Surreal

Across both landscape and still-life, the contemporary photographer has honed a knack for adding labyrinthine ambiguity to his representations of very real places and objects.

Feature Article | Jewels

Vivienne Becker Meets Fabio Salini

The jewelry historian and Phillips contributor meets the Italian jeweler known for his unique use of unexpected materials.

Feature Article | Design

Consider the Weathervane

A group of 19th-century weathervanes from the collection of Florence Knoll Bassett turns out to be strikingly modern.

Feature Article | Design

House Calls: Jay Sae Jung Oh

We caught up with the Seattle-based artist and industrial designer, whose work spans both one-of-a-kind pieces as well as a lifestyle brand.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

How We're Adapting: Portland Art Museum

Brian Ferriso, Director of the Portland Art Museum, shares a bit about how the institution is weathering the current storm, and what he hopes will follow.

Feature Article | Jewels

Amulet Jewels: What's Past is Present

Senior Specialist Eva Violante takes a closer look at two ancient motifs that have inspired jewelers for millennia.

Feature Article | Design

Ingo Maurer: Poet of Light

Collapsing form and function, this unique work exemplifies the German designer's inventive approach to design.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

How We're Adapting: Spotlight on Chicago

We caught up with two Chicago-based institutions to find out more about how they see themselves evolving during an unprecedented situation.

Feature Article | Design

House Calls: Marcantonio Brandolini d'Adda

We spoke with the Venetian glassmaker, who brings a modern perspective to one of Italy's oldest artistic traditions.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Specialist's Edit: Charlotte Gibbs

Our Associate Specialist and Head of Online Sales, Europe, tells us how she's keeping connected with the arts during her time in isolation.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Off The Wall: A Selection of Furniture Designed by Contemporary and Post-War Artists

We delve into an exceptional group of works that derive their form from their function, all now open for bidding in our online auction Desktop.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Donna Huanca: Making Her Mark

From intoxicating performance works to mesmerizing paintings, her practice busts boundaries and challenges taboos. Hettie Judah surveys Huanca’s work and the intriguing relationship between pigment and performance.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Miety Heiden on What's Next for Private Sales

Miety Heiden, Head of Private Sales, discusses Phillips' expansion beyond auction and our new online viewing room.

Feature Article | Design

House Calls: Kathy Butterly

We caught up with the New York ceramist to find out more about her practice.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Spelling it Out

Online Sales Property Manager Fred Blauth takes a closer look at three artists in Current Mood who utilize text to get their message across.

Feature Article | Design

How We're Adapting: LACMA

We spoke with Bobbye Tigerman, Marilyn B. and Calvin B. Gross Curator of Decorative Arts and Design at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, to hear about how she and the museum are reacting to today's unique challenges.

Feature Article | Editions

Sarah Browne on Collecting Prints and Joining Phillips

Our newest specialist in Modern and Contemporary Editions spoke with Robert Kennan, Head of Editions, Europe, to share a bit about her background in the arts and which prints she covets most.

Feature Article | Design

House Calls: Formafantasma

The Amsterdam-based Design duo shares a few of their favorite objects and reflects on their practice.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

How We're Adapting: Fountainhead

As part of our ongoing commitment to the arts and our institutional partners, we're checking in to see how they've adjusted to these challenging times. First, we caught up with artists from Miami's Fountainhead Residency and Studios.

Feature Article | Editions

Specialist's Edit: Jason Osborne

Our Associate Specialist and Cataloguer for Editions shares how he's staying in touch with the art world while working from home.

Feature Article | Editions

Andy Warhol: 15 Minutes of Fame

"In the future, everyone will be world-famous for 15 minutes." Reflecting on the Pop superstar’s famous words, Louisa Earl, Phillips Editions Cataloguer, highlights 15 Warhol prints to remember.

Announcement | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Auction Update: Temporary Closures & Postponements

A message from our CEO and Global Chairwoman concerning ongoing events.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Charlotte Raybaud in Conversation with Eric So

Our Specialist and Head of Evening Sale sat down with a Hong Kong artist who blurred the lines between toy, design, object and art.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Curator Christine Y. Kim on Julie Mehretu at LACMA

Phillips is a proud sponsor of the first retrospective of Julie Mehretu's groundbreaking work at LACMA. We sat down with curator Christine Y. Kim to learn more about the exhibition.

Feature Article | Photographs

Specialist's Edit: Sarah Krueger

As the world works from home, Auctioneer and Head of Photographs, New York, Sarah Krueger shares some of the ways she's keeping connected with the art world and beyond.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In Conversation with Lihua Tung

We spoke with our new Senior Specialist to find out more about her longtime passion for the arts and the exciting auction season to come in Hong Kong.

Feature Article | Design

House Calls: Christy Matson

In the first installment of our new Design series, we speak with Los Angeles-based textile artist Christy Matson and learn more about her practice.

Feature Article | Watches

Historic Models Continue To Inspire Watchmakers in 2020

Don’t call it a comeback. Watchmakers have been digging in their archives for years to introduce the latest generation of watch enthusiasts to historical models. Today we take a look at the latest evolution of two beloved chronographs.

Feature Article | Photographs

Photographers: Thinking Beyond the Box

We take a closer look at photographs that push the technical and aesthetic limits of the medium, highlighting its endless creative possibilities.

Auction Update | Hong Kong

Announcement: Hong Kong Spring 2020 Auctions

As we monitor ongoing developments, our spring sales in Hong Kong are scheduled to proceed as planned.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Elizabeth Goldberg in Conversation with Theresa Papanikolas

Our Senior International Specialist in American Art spoke with the Seattle Art Museum's Ann M. Barwick Curator of American Art about an exhibition celebrating the addition of an early Georgia O'Keeffe masterpiece to the museum's collection.

Feature Article | Photographs

Ansel Adams: The Photograph as Mural

Adams' large-scale photographs both preceded and predicted contemporary trends in the medium.

Feature Article | Photographs

Warhol and Basquiat

Two of New York's most famous artists produced a pair of works that set the stage for further collaboration.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Sandy Powell on Derek Jarman

The award-winning costume designer speaks on her friend, the late artist and director Derek Jarman. A one-of-a-kind suit belonging to Powell will be sold at Phillips to support Art Fund's campaign to save Jarman's home, Prospect Cottage, in Dungeness, for future generations.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Anya Hindmarch on Sustainability, Responsibility and Collecting

We spoke with the iconic British designer following the London Fashion Week launch party for her new eco-friendly tote in Phillips' Berkeley Square galleries.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Stand Together Through Thick and Thin

In the face of a global public health crisis, Phillips is proud to support this Shanghai-based online charity auction benefiting those affected by the COVID-19 virus.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In Search of Noah Davis

Nearly five years after the artist's untimely death, the art world is just beginning to realize Davis' seminal contributions to painting and his community.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Whatever Happened to My Youth: KAWS & McCarthy's Toontowns

In their appropriation of childlike pop-culture imagery, these contemporary artists create surreal and even macabre scenes that challenge outdated notions of 'high' and 'low' culture.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Need to Be Seen

Two young artists use their respective practices to confront subjective social constructs and norms.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Julian Schnabel: Beyond the Biennale

Since his 1980 inclusion in the famed Biennale di Venezia, Schnabel's Neo-Expressionist style has become emblematic of the decade.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Ed Clark's Pride of Place

Among the largest and earliest works from Clark's oeuvre to come to auction, 'Louisiana' is a prime example of the artist's talent for representing his environment through abstraction.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Intimacy & Invisibility: Kerry James Marshall & Njideka Akunyili Crosby

We delve into two works on paper that unpack diverse stories within the black American experience.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Gokita, Kusaka, Nara & More: Japanese Artists in Paper Jam

Learn more about five works on paper from our online-only auction.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Amoako Boafo's Bold Brushstrokes

As the Accra-born, Vienna-based artist makes his Evening Sale debut, a gestural approach to figuration recalls some of art history's greatest painters.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Who Are the YBAs?

Rising to prominence during a critical moment in British history, this group of artists continues to shape the landscape of contemporary art.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Duane Hanson: An Unflinching Eye

Emblematic of the artist's oeuvre in the 1980s, 'Surfer' uses California cool to examine the deeper anxiety embedded in American life.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

A Collector's Story: Robert Tibbles

Inspired by the dynamic London art scene that surrounded him, Robert Tibbles worked directly with some of Britain's greatest living artists to build his exceptional collection.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Distant and Familiar: Tschabalala Self

Throughout the up-and-coming artist's oeuvre, figures both "deliberate and delicate" strike a balance between portraiture and caricature.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

A Vision in Red: Property from a Private Swiss Collection

Highlighted by an exceptional El Anatsui installation, this important collection is unified by a sense of energetic complexity.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Julie Curtiss' Navigation Towards the Real

The up-and-coming French artist often utilizes ambiguous sections of the female body to create elaborate narrative parables.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Double Trouble

Executed at the inception of Sturtevant's conceptual practice, two exceptional examples of 'Warhol Flowers' are much more than mere copies.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

VR Walkthrough: 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Tour our Evening & Day 20th Century & Contemporary Art Sales in this virtual reality walkthrough from 30 Berkeley Square. On view: KAWS, Tschabalala Self, Keith Haring, El Anatsui and more.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Keith Haring's Allegorical Assault

We explore the cover lot from our upcoming London Evening Sale: an early Keith Haring masterpiece.

Feature Article | Editions

Start Your Editions Collection with Phillips

Our international team of specialists suggests first-time purchases under £5,000.

Feature Article | Editions

David Hockney: Experimentation and Evolution

An artist unafraid to boldly embrace change, Hockney's printmaking methods have transformed repeatedly over the course of his career.

Feature Article | Editions

The Iconography of a Masterpiece

Made at the pinnacle of Picasso's long career, 'La Minotauromachie' is rife with references to the Old Masters as well as the artist's own work.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

The Robert Tibbles Collection: Young British Artists & More

Phillips is pleased to present seminal works by Damien Hirst, Michael Craig-Martin, Gilbert & George, Sarah Morris and more to be offered in London in 2020.

Feature Article | Editions

A Continuing Obsession: The Seven States of 'La Minotauromachie'

We delve further into the printmaking process of one of Picasso's most important graphic works of the 20th Century, coming to auction at Phillips this January.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

The Year in 20th Century & Contemporary Art

We run down our top highlights from 2019, spanning Norman Rockwell, Alex Katz, Jean-Michel Basquiat, Mickalene Thomas and many more.

Feature Article | Watches

The Year In Watches

The Watches team at Phillips in Association with Bacs & Russo reflects on how they managed to maintain momentum throughout 2019, with multiple new world records and two "white glove" auctions.

Feature Article | Photographs

The Year in Photographs

Our international Photographs team recaps the biggest moments of 2019, including artist records, important partnerships and more.

Feature Article | Jewels

The Year in Jewels

Colored diamonds, signed pieces and growth define 2019 for Phillips Jewels.

Feature Article | Design

The Year in Design

2019 has been an important year for Design at Phillips, bringing a white glove-sale, major private collections, and an expansion into online auctions.

Feature Article | Editions

The Year in Editions

With a myriad of new records and staggering digital engagement, 2019 has been a stellar year for Editions at Phillips.

Feature Article | Design

Jean Royère: A Whimsical Approach

Four iconic works, all coming to auction this December at Phillips, typify the designer's playful, organic forms.

Feature Article | Design

A Symphony of Curves

Glenn Adamson explains the surprisingly historical roots of a Jeroen Verhoeven masterwork.

Feature Article | Design

Single-Track: An Interview with Eva Hild

We sat down with the Swedish sculptor to learn more about her practice and lifelong preoccupation with clay.

Feature Article | Design

Turning the Centuries: Works from the Ann and Robert Fromer Collection

Learn more about a seminal group of artists whose work came to define Art Deco and Art Nouveau aesthetics.

Feature Article | Design

Consider the Weathervane

A group of nineteenth-century weathervanes from the collection of Florence Knoll Bassett turns out to be strikingly modern.

Feature Article | Design

Precious Metalwork: Alexander Calder's Jewelry

Known for his multidisciplinary and prolific oeuvre, Calder had a uniquely personal relationship with these wearable pieces.

Feature Article | Design

Alessandro Mendini and Giorgio Gregori at the XVII Milan Triennale

A 1985 exhibition of postmodern designers including Sottsass, Venturi and Mendini explored new ideas for radical living.

Feature Article | Watches

Al Pacino and Martin Sheen on Marlon Brando

Two legends of the silver screen reflect on their fondest memories of their friend and fellow actor.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Turner Prize Winner Oscar Murillo's Constant Motion

Winning the prestigious award catapults the young painter into a league with some of British art's living legends. In a historic first, Murillo shares the honor with the other three nominees.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Mickalene Thomas: Better Nights

Timed to open with Art Basel Miami Beach, the artist's latest immersive installation at the Bass Museum echoes happy memories in her mother's home.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Freud's Famous Friends: David Dawson

As part of our ongoing partnership with Phaidon, we're sharing an exclusive interview with David Dawson, a painter and director of the Lucian Freud Archive who served as Freud's studio assistant for two decades.

Feature Article | Watches

Video: The Watch that Conquered Everest

For this third attempt at Everest, adventurer Cory Richards partnered with Vacheron Constantin to create a watch that could accompany him through one of the most grueling and dangerous climbing expeditions in the world.

Feature Article | Watches

Two in One: The Urwerk AMC Wristwatch and Clock

With their AMC, Urwerk has created a milestone in 21st-century horology. New York specialist Isabella Proia explains.

Feature Article | Jewels

A Family Tradition: Aletto Brothers Craftsmanship

From our December Jewels auction in New York, a brooch and pair of earrings in rubies and diamonds highlight the masterful and distinctive craftsmanship of Alfredo Aletto and his family's business.

Feature Article | Jewels

Splurge vs. Steal: A Jewelry Gift Guide

Just in time for the holiday season, we're highlighting a selection of jewels ranging from the restrained to the extravagant.

Feature Article | Jewels

An Exceptional Tiffany Blue Diamond

Incredibly rare and exceedingly difficult to cut, blue diamonds rank among the most prized gemstones.

Feature Article | Watches

TAG Heuer Monaco Piece d’Art 50th Anniversary

TAG Heuer's Monaco has been around for fifty years, but the watchmaker has never presented one like this before.

Sevan Bçakç in Conversation with Vivienne Becker

Jewelry historian Vivienne Becker sat down with the famed craftsman to find out more about his story, process and ongoing commitment to charity.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In Conversation with Cool Culture's Candice Anderson

Phillips is proud to support Cool Culture, a non-profit dedicated to improving access to New York City's world-class cultural institutions. We sat down with Executive Director Candice Anderson to learn more about the important work they do.

All About Bulgari

Known for their bold, colorful and distinctly Roman designs, Bulgari remains one of the marquee names in jewelry.

Phillips Achieves Standout Results in Hong Kong

With feverish bidding and eight new artist records, Phillips achieved the highest-ever total for a 20th Century & Contemporary Art & Design auction series staged in Asia.

KAWS Comes to Hong Kong

Across this November's Evening and Day Sales, several key works highlight the diversity of the artist's oeuvre.

We asked the team who put together The Hong Kong Watch Auction: NINE catalogue to reveal some of their favorite watches from the sale.

Spotlight on Genieve Figgis

Derived from history yet unmistakably contemporary, the Irish painter's work combines the humorous with the grotesque.

Perfectly Versatile: Four Convertible Jewels

In an era where your phone also functions as a camera and credit card, high jewelry has caught up with the multi-functional trend.

Provenance and Why it Matters

In the upcoming Hong Kong Watch Auction: NINE, the first evening session will see a remarkable assortment of over 50 lots being offered directly from their original owners.

Jewels, Jadeite & More: A Hong Kong Gift Guide

Specialist Louisa Chan highlights some of her favorite pieces coming to auction just as the holiday season begins.

Video: Jean-Michel Basquiat's Dichotomous Anti-Painting

Zao Wou-Ki's "Labyrinth of Light"

This work on canvas, with artistic roots in Chinese calligraphy and English Romanticism, illustrates a swirling battle between the four elements.

HOCA Foundation Benefit Auction

Proceeds from ten Day Sale works, all donated directly by artists, will support the cultural initiatives of the Hong Kong Contemporary Art Foundation.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Organic Abstraction Across Five Important Works

Drawing from both Eastern and Western traditions, artists working from the 20th century to today developed unique pictorial languages inspired by the world around them.

Behind the Van Cleef & Arpels 'Zip' Necklace

Offered in our Hong Kong Jewels & Jadeite sale this November, this iconic piece was once thought impossible to produce.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Norman Rockwell's Gift for Storytelling

As one of the American master's most iconic images comes to auction, we look at depictions of a day at the doctor's office from various eras of art history.

Feature Article | Jewels

Argyle Diamond Mine: Last of the World’s Pink Diamond Reserves

Jewelry historian Vivienne Becker delves into how a single mine in remote Western Australia changed the trajectory of an entire industry.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Maria Lassnig: Figuration and the Abstracted Self

In two works from a distinguished private collection, the Austrian painter approaches her own body and its limitations in turns both humorous and anguished.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In the Small Hours: Philip Guston's Late Figurative Painting

Noted Guston scholar Dr. Kosme de Barañano contextualizes two works from the American artist's later oeuvre, both coming to Phillips from A Discerning Vision: Property from an Important Private Collection.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Basquiat's Victory in 'The Ring'

Painted at the height of his short career, a work laden with symbolism recalls the artist's past, present and future.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Richard Diebenkorn from Berkeley to Albuquerque

Two landscape paintings demonstrate Diebenkorn's evolving approach to abstraction over the course of the 1950s.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

A Discerning Vision: Property from an Important Private Collection

This November, Phillips is pleased to offer an outstanding selection of over 50 post-war and contemporary works from an important private collection across our New York 20th Century & Contemporary Art Evening and Day Sales.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Making Modern: Property from the Collection of Florence Knoll Bassett

Throughout the fall in New York, Phillips offers twentieth-century & contemporary art and design from the collection of Florence Knoll Bassett. Paul Makovsky, Editor-in-Chief for Contract Magazine, tells the story of the pioneering American architect and her lasting legacy.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Fall Auction Highlights: Now on View at Saks Fifth Avenue

We've partnered with Saks Fifth Avenue to display a selection of pieces from our upcoming New York Auctions in 20th Century and Contemporary Art, Watches and Jewels.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In Conversation with Sophia Kinell

Our San Francisco regional representative explains how the art world is changing in this innovative region.

Feature Article | Photographs

ULTIMATE: Eight Exceptional Works

Ranging from unique and sold-out works to those appearing at auction for the first time, the one thing these eight works have in common is that they are only available at Phillips.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Kehinde Wiley: Redefining Portraiture

An early work reveals the thematic consistency that defines the African American artist's oeuvre.

Feature Article | Editions

Joan Mitchell's Approach to Printmaking

New York painter Joan Mitchell was also a master printmaker, as demonstrated by her work with Kenneth Tyler of Tyler Graphics in the 1980s and '90s.

Feature Article | Editions

Game, Set & Match

Our specialists review some of the complete sets from artists like Haring, Warhol and Johns coming to auction in our October Editions sale.

Feature Article | Editions

Shades of Gray

Through the work of Picasso, Ruscha, Johns and Hockney, we explore some of the diverse formal and thematic possibilities of the grayscale color palette.

Feature Article | Photographs

LATIN AMERICA: Photography from Mexico to Argentina

Ahead of our London Photographs auction, we're highlighting a standout group of works from across this dynamic and diverse region.

Feature Article | Editions

M.C. Escher and the Mezzotint

We take a closer look at the rare printmaking method that's been used by artists from the 17th century to the present.

Feature Article | Photographs

Early 20th Century Photography in France: Brancusi, Man Ray & Cartier-Bresson

Through three important works, we explore Modernism's impact on photography during one of the most consequential periods of European history.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

First Reveal: Lee Krasner Now on View at The Box

Next up in the Box @ Phillips, we're highlighting a monumental Lee Krasner collage from the artist's celebrated practice.

Feature Article | Photographs

Pieter Hugo: In Conversation

Phillips’ Co-Head of Photographs Yuka Yamaji and artist Pieter Hugo sit down to discuss his 'Kin' series, the story behind his work 'Green Point Common' and what photography means to him.

Feature Article | Design

Gio Ponti's Apta Tables and the Ecstasy of Movement

Curator and art historian Brian Kish delves into some of the Italian master's final work as a designer.

Feature Article | Design

Hans J. Wegner's 'Chinese' Armchair

Reinterpreted from traditional Chinese models, Wegner’s meticulous armchair design incorporates an integrated construction to achieve simplicity of form.

Feature Article | Design

Joris Laarman's 'Bone' Armchair

Laarman’s innovative chair design explores the intersections of design, technology and science.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

First Reveal: Keith Haring Now on View at the Box

This week, we reveal a monumental Keith Haring painting that reflects the artist's enduring interest in semiotics and storytelling.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Young, Fresh and In-Demand: Emerging Artists in 24/7

Learn more about some of the new market darlings making an appearance in our Hong Kong-based online auction.

Feature Article | Design

Solemnity on Pinwheels

Gio Ponti scholar Brian Kish explains the history behind an executive desk of grand scale with playful tectonic elements.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

New Records and Fresh Artists Define Frieze Week Auctions

Offering strong contemporary works with international caché, Phillips realizes over £35 million across Evening and Day Sales.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Beyond the Hype

As collecting tastes change rapidly, Phillips Hong Kong is debuting an online sale and exhibition that reflect a broadening cultural language.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Alex Katz's Eternal Muse

Following an artistic tradition in the vein of Picasso and Modigliani, Katz brings cinematic energy to a timeless portrait of his wife, Ada.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Zeng Fanzhi Removes the Mask

Zeng draws on painterly traditions from the East and West to create a dynamic yet introspective portrait of one of the 20th century's most important artists.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Simone Leigh's Unflinching Silhouette

Phillips is pleased to offer 'Shower Cap' as the American artist comes off a year filled with crowning achievements.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Peter Doig: 'Hinged in Reality'

Existing somewhere between figuration and abstraction, 'House of Pictures' invites the viewer in while simultaneously obfuscating closer analysis.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Crafting Womanhood

Across three masterworks, Rosemarie Trockel, Tschabalala Self and Tracey Emin subvert traditional artistic norms to tell stories uniquely their own.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

First Reveal: KAWS Now on View at the Box

Each Friday, we'll be unveiling works from our upcoming 20th Century & Contemporary Art Evening Sale in New York. Next up in the Box @ Phillips, we're highlighting a KAWS painting that draws from his signature pop culture references.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Keith Haring's Cartoon Reality

Inspired by some of art history's heavyweights, Haring lent his unique linear style to one of Walt Disney's most iconic villains.

Feature Article | Photographs

Performance, Feminism and Photography

We explore the commonalities between this season's cover lots by Marina Abramovi and Hannah Wilke, both of whom made transformative contributions to the field of photography by using the self as a subject.

Feature Article | Photographs

Berenice Abbott: Documenting a Modernizing Manhattan

In the 1920s and '30s, photographer Berenice Abbott captured an ever-evolving city.

Feature Article | Design

In Conversation with Björn Weckström

We sat down with the Finnish designer to learn more about the driving philosophies behind his long and successful career.

Feature Article | Photographs

The Feminist Thread: Photographs from the Collection of Helen Kornblum

We highlight a selection of dynamic lots coming to auction this October, all from a seminal collection celebrating work by female photographers.

Feature Article | Design

Building the Quico Collection

The owners of Quico, a boutique in Tokyo's trendy Harajuku district, tell us about their decades-long love for Nordic design.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Louise Nevelson: Delicacy and Strength 

As two of her sculptures come to auction this September, we look closer at the opposing elements that define the American artist's oeuvre.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Light, Language & L.A.

Ed Ruscha's 'High-Speed Gardening' fuses two of the artist's best-known motifs to create a playful, paradoxical work.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In Conversation with Gina Beavers

Fresh from her acclaimed solo show at MoMA PS1, artist Gina Beavers spoke with us about her practice, inspirations and recent move across the Hudson River.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Batia Ofer in Conversation with Joana Vasconcelos

Make-A-Wish® U.K. patron Batia Ofer sat down with artist Joana Vasconcelos to discuss their upcoming charity event and Vasconcelos' body of work as a whole.

Feature Article | Jewels

Ana Khouri on Exhibiting in London

One year after her blockbuster New York exhibition, artist and jeweler Ana Khouri brings forth a new slate of pieces for a show across the pond.

Feature Article | Editions

Specialist Picks: Evening & Day Editions

The London Editions team takes a closer look at their favorite lots coming to auction on 12 September, all now on view at 30 Berkeley Square.

Feature Article | Editions

Bridget Riley Makes Her Mark

With a career stretching back to the swinging 60s, Bridget Riley remains one of Great Britain's most important living artists. We trace the trajectory of her career through a series of editions coming to auction this September in London.

Feature Article | Jewels

The Journey of the Indore Pears from Chaumet to Mouawad

Susan Abeles, Senior International Jewels Specialist, reveals the fascinating backstory behind a pair of pear-shaped diamonds that passed through Chaumet, Mauboussin, Harry Winston and Mouawad.

Feature Article | Editions

Reinvention in Repetition: Mel Bochner’s Monoprints

We explore the creative process used in making some of the American artist's most iconic prints.

Feature Article | Editions

Sigmar Polke: The Ugly, the Sublime and the Uncanny

Influenced by both of the Cold War's opposing forces, Sigmar Polke and his contemporaries created Pop Art with a uniquely German twist.

Feature Article | Editions

Back to School with Editions in London

Back to school, back to work and back to the rostrum. Our London team browses the first auction of the season, Evening & Day Editions, to find a piece based on everyone's favorite school subject.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Walker Art Center: Avant Garden 2019

For the eighth consecutive year, Phillips supports Avant Garden, the Walker Art Center's annual benefit, and is proud to sponsor its charitable auction featuring works by Matthew Barney, Jasper Johns, Paulina Olowska and more.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In Conversation with Gary Card

The artist and set designer told us more about his work for HYSTERICAL, the immersive selling exhibition that's taken over our Berkeley Square galleries.

Featured in WWD: Kyoko Hattori on Phillips' Expansion in Japan

Our Regional Director explained to 'Women's Wear Daily Japan' why Phillips' relocation to Roppongi will better serve Japanese collectors.

Luc Tuymans in Conversation with Marianne Hoet

Phillips' Deputy Chairwoman, Europe, sat down with the Belgian artist to discuss his seminal early painting, 'Schwarzheide.'

Phillips x Phaidon: Art & Queer Culture

Celebrating the second edition of Phaidon's survey of visual art and alternative sexuality from the 19th century to present, we got an exclusive look inside to see some of the most important artists featured.

The Observance of Craftsmanship: Design Classics from the Collection of Terry Ellis and Keiko Kitamura

Coming from Japan and Scandinavia, refined examples from the couple’s collection went under the hammer in our London-based online sale, HEATWAVE.

Feature Article | Design

Bertoia: The Metalworker

As part of our ongoing partnership with Phaidon, we're excerpting from Beverly Twitchell's latest biography of the prolific designer, sculptor and artist.

Remembering Carlos Cruz-Diez

In this previously unpublished interview, Carlos Cruz-Diez and Phillips Specialist Valentina Garcia discuss the late artist's decades-long exploration of color and the early challenges that came to define his career.

VR Walkthrough: HYSTERICAL

Tour our selling exhibition, HYSTERICAL, in this virtual reality walkthrough from 30 Berkeley Square. On view: Kenny Scharf, Cindy Sherman, Ugo Rondinone, KAWS and Yayoi Kusama.

VR Walkthrough: HEATWAVE

Tour pieces from our online sale in this virtual reality walkthrough. On view: Nicolas Party, Wolfgang Tillmans, Tala Madani, George Condo, Sori Yanagi and more.

Featured on Whitewall: What Collectors Can Expect from Phillips X

Whitewall Magazine sat down with Miety Heiden, Head of Private Sales, to discuss Phillips' expansion beyond auction and this summer's New York selling exhibition, 'NOMEN'.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Lynette Yiadom-Boakye and the Pensive Interiority of Figurative Art

"When I think of the figure, I think of immortality or an otherness that is just out of this world, representing an endless possibility," says the British painter of her own work. Preview a stunningly tall 2015 portrait from our London Evening Sale.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Marlene Dumas and the Eternal Search for Meaning

Painted in 1988,  ‘Losing (Her Meaning)’ is an early masterpiece from Marlene Dumas’ body of beguilingly sensual paintings reflecting her preoccupation with the female body.

Golf Legend Jack Nicklaus to Auction His Rolex Day-Date for Children's Hospitals 

Phillips is thrilled to present this iconic DayDate — one of the most storied Rolex watches to appear on the market — in December 2019 during a tightly curated and important thematic auction in New York.

Joan Miró in the Fiterman Collection

Focusing on three works, all coming under the hammer in London's 20th Century and Contemporary Art Day Sale, we delve into the Catalan master's assemblage sculptures.

We examine the myriad influences and meanings of the South African artist's work, coming to auction this June in London.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Game Changer: Property from the Estate of Ryan Brant

From the family long-associated with 'Interview Magazine', Ryan Brant amassed a colorful, playful and crisply contemporary collection of art.

Pablo Picasso: Reinventing Rembrandt

We explore an important work from the Fiterman Collection, painted during a period when the artist found new inspiration in the Dutch Old Masters.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Alex Rodriguez in Conversation with Robert Manley

Our Worldwide Co-Head of 20th Century & Contemporary Art sat down with baseball superstar Alex Rodriguez to discuss his attraction to American contemporary art and his paintings by Jean-Michel Basquiat and Richard Prince going under the hammer in London.

From India to Venice: Property from an Esteemed European Collection

Ahead of this June's Day Sale in London, we examine a seminal collection of works by contemporary Indian artists.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Luc Tuymans' Sinister Understatement

A visual materialization of memory, ‘Schwarzheide’ captures the weight of history with stark restraint.

Roy Lichtenstein's 'The Conductor'

We trace the art historical roots of a Pop Art masterpiece, from Georges Seurat to Gino Severini.

Vladimir Tatlin: 'Monument to the Third International'  

We shed some light on the fascinating art historical context behind Phillips' latest New York selling exhibition, now on view at "The Cube" at 432 Park Avenue.

A Democratic Taste

Douglas Fogle, former Chief Curator at Hammer Museum, Los Angeles, explores the personal relationships Miles and Shirley Fiterman built with artists over their years as passionate collectors.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

False Facts at the Art World's Olympics: An Early Look at the Venice Biennale

Phillips contributor Jad Salfiti recounts some of the best shows on view through 24 November.

Naomi Beckwith on Laurie Simmons at MCA Chicago

With 'Laurie Simmons: Big Camera/Little Camera' now on view at MCA Chicago, Phillips' Carol Ehlers caught up with the museum's senior curator to discuss the ongoing power and relevance of the artist's work.

Virgil Abloh and Venice's Rising Waters

A provocative showing of contemporary art and design, featuring the likes of Virgil Abloh, Studio Drift and Mathieu Lehanneur, offers commentary on the shifting tides of art, design, technology and nature.

With three categories on view in our Park Avenue galleries this past week, specialists Cordelia Lembo, Susan Abeles and Rachel Peart selected their favorite pieces from each sale.

Splurge vs. Steal: A Jewelry Style Guide 

Graduate Gemologist Anne Mock picks some of her favorites, from classic to contemporary, at a range of price points.

Senior Specialist Eva Violante looks ahead to some of the most exciting property coming under the hammer across our two Jewels sales.

Friendship Through Photography: Dorothea Lange and William Heick

Tracing the warm correspondence that led Lange to send a fellow photographer a print of her most iconic work, which comes to auction on 7 June in New York

Feature Article | Design

A Contemporary Trio: Newson, Wanders and Donat Subvert Materials and Techniques

Three pieces from our June Design auction reference and reinvent past modes of design.

Feature Article | Editions

Jörg Schellmann on His Most Successful Collaborations

The renowned publisher opens up about his experiences working with some of the most prominent artists of the 20th century, including Joseph Beuys and Keith Haring.

Feature Article | Editions

Dan Flavin: Warm Light and Daylight

We explore the artist's path to discovering the restrained medium that would define his career.

Feature Article | Editions

Anne Schneider-Wilson in Conversation with Christo

Our Senior Editions Specialist sat down with the pioneering artist to discuss his longstanding work with Edition Schellmann.

Feature Article | Design

Designing for the Manik Bagh Palace: Eckart Muthesius and the Maharaja

In the 1920s and '30s, the Maharaja of Indore cultivated a close-knit network of visionaries in art and design. Among them, the German architect Eckart Muthesius produced an important sideboard which features in our June Design auction.

A Cartier Brooch from a Bygone Era

From the personal collection of a self-made New York millionaire, a Cartier emerald, diamond and platinum brooch sheds light on the jeweler's Art Deco design era. Susan Abeles, Senior International Specialist, provides an in-depth look.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Got the Time: Matt Dike & JeanMichel Basquiat

'To Repel Ghosts' provides an extraordinary glimpse into Basquiat's time in L.A. and his working friendship with record producer Matt Dike. Writer Peter Relic recounts the story, based on his years spent interviewing Dike.

East Hampton Abstraction: Willem de Kooning's Pinnacle in 1976

In advance of our New York Evening Sale, we examine a painting by de Kooning at the height of his powers.

Phillips x Artelligence Podcast: Jean-Michel Basquiat's Self Portrait from the Collection of Matt Dike

The Art Market Monitor's Marion Maneker speaks to Scott Nussbaum and Fred Hoffman about the unique collection coming to auction in New York.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Christina Quarles' Hybrid Universe

We unpack the layers of ambiguity in this up-and-coming American artist's cryptic paintings.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Atsuko Tanaka: Creating the New Japan

Radical, pioneering and avant-garde, Tanaka changed the post-war landscape as the foremost female artist in the Gutai group.

Max Büsser: The Creative Force Of The Watchmaking Industry

Our Specialist Arthur Touchot sat down with the independent watchmaker ahead of the sale.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Mark Tobey Over Time: Charting A Painting's Provenance from the 1950s

Mark Tobey's 'Desert Town (Wild City)' takes us back to a momentous time in the artist's career. This work's esteemed and storied provenance captures the remarkable trajectory of an artist garnering widespread international acclaim.

Feature Article | Watches

Vacheron Constantin's Most Important Wristwatch Found After Decades 

This May, Phillips will sell what many consider to be the most important wristwatch ever made by Vacheron Constantin, putting an end to a 27-year-long treasure hunt.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In Conversation with Simon Butler of Migrate Art

This month in London, Phillips and Migrate Art present unique, charitable works by Sean Scully, Rachel Whiteread and Kevin Francis Gray, among many others, created from salvaged pencils and crayons from the Calais Jungle refugee camp.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In Conversation with Faye Weiwei

We sat down with the British painter to find out more about her recent foray into working with neon.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Behind 'Foujita / Sanyu: Muses & Models

International Specialist Clara Rivollet breaks down the fascinating historical context behind her travelling selling exhibition focused on two Franco-Asian artists.

Feature Article | Photographs

Helmut Newton's Amazons

Highlighted in our 4 April Photographs auction, we reflect on how one of Newton's most iconic works revolutionized fashion photography.

Feature Article | Photographs

Susie Tomkins Buell: A Collector's Story

In anticipation of April's auction 'Passion & Humanity: The Susie Tompkins Buell Collection,' we look at the collecting philosophy behind the American entrepreneur and market maker.

Feature Article | Museum Partnerships

Renovation and Transformation: The New Norton Museum of Art, Designed by Norman Foster

In our latest interview, we caught up with Norton Museum of Art Deputy Director Sam Ankerson about the institution's major renovation, its new suite of programming and its expanded role within the Palm Beach community.

Feature Article | Design

Featured on Whitewall: 'The Phillips Team Talks Design'

Our London team sat down with Whitewall's editors in anticipation of our Important Design auction on 21 March.

Feature Article | Design

Rooms of Enchantment: Ponti in the Lucano House

Curator and art historian Brian Kish reveals the story behind one of Gio Ponti's greatest collaborative projects.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Allen Jones and the Illusion of Space

Using a visual language adapted from American advertising, Jones creates a world of fragmented tension.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

Presence and Absence in David Hammons' Body Prints

We look at the artist's origins in combining the corporeal and the ephemeral.

Feature Article | 20th Century & Contemporary Art

In Conversation with Kimberly Drew

We sat down with the art historian, speaker and influencer for a conversation on her Instagram, her passion for black art and her take on our latest exhibition, 'AMERICAN AFRICAN AMERICAN'.

Feature Article | Jewels

Auction Archive: Mathilde Bonaparte's Exquisite Jewels

International Jewels Specialist Anellie Manolas revisits one of the most historically important jewelry collections ever offered at auction.

Feature Article | Watches

Aurel Bacs Shares His Personal Omega Speedmaster

In conversation with Monochrome Watches, Aurel Bacs described his 1980s Omega reference 145.022-69ST with an unusual bezel and storied history.

Feature Article | Watches

Iron Man's Watch: The Urwerk UR-110RG

Featured in 'Spiderman: Homecoming', this Urwerk Reference UR-110RG—sold in 2018 in Geneva to benefit Manusodany, a Haitian non-profit organization—was chosen by actor and watch collector Robert Downey Jr. for his portrayal of Tony Stark.

carouselItems.description: RM011, 2014 in Rose Gold, Full Set
carouselItems.descriptionWithMarkup: Launched in 2007, the RM011 Flyback Chronograph with Annual Calendar immediately became Richard Milles most sought after watch. Favoured by Felipe Massa and now discontinued, this 18ct rose gold and titanium example from 2014 comes to us with its original RM winding box, signed certificate, and two additional Richard Mille vented rubber straps.

carouselItems.description: Seadweller 16600, F502817, automatic,  stainless steel, circa 2004
carouselItems.descriptionWithMarkup: The 16600 Sea-Dweller has always been a collectors choice, rarer and considerably upgraded compared to the classic 16610 Sub Date, these rugged 5 digit models have been growing in demand since they were discontinued in 2008. Found in outstanding, seemingly unpolished condition, this 2004 F-series example is complete with the original Rolex box, punched certificate, booklets, tool, anchor and tag.

A reference that introduced a new generation of Patek "in-house" chronograph movements following the lemania based 5070. This first generation example cased in yellow gold is found in excellent condition and supplied with full accessories including International Guarantee, box and leather pouch.
A fresh to market, original owner Patek Philippe Nautilus with Annual Calendar. Supplied by the prestigious retailer Wempe in 2012 and found complete with full accessories.

carouselItems.description: Rolex Daytona L series 4 line 200 Bezel, full set
carouselItems.descriptionWithMarkup: One of the rarest and most beautiful 'Zenith' Daytonas, this L-series example was born with the ultra-desirable '4 Line' dial, early 200 unit bezel and first generation matte finish Oyster bracelet. Almost impossible to find complete with the original punched certificate and box, this example also has Rolex service papers confirming this rare 16520's authenticity inside and out.

An outstanding, unworn, original owner example of the Patek Philippe ref. 5575G, released to commemorate the 175 Anniversary of the formation of the brand and combines a hugely popular complication with a moon phase and contemporary design. One of just 1300 examples produced in white gold it is considered by many collectors as the most striking of all modern examples of the complication.
carouselItems.wModelName: World Time 175 Anniversary Limited Edition of 1300 pieces

carouselItems.description: Cosmograph, Ref. 6241 Paul Newman, black dial
carouselItems.descriptionWithMarkup: An outstanding example of an iconic Paul Newman Cosmograph Daytona with superb original dial and with the popular combination of acrylic bezel and pump pushers.

sticky.altText: The Geneva Watch Auction: Eleven Tomorrow
